  • Inferno (parts 12-13) (progs 47-48) (Tom Tully - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Meltdown Man (parts 13-14) (prog 190-191) (Alan Hebden - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Return to Armageddon (parts 11-12) (progs 195-196) (Malcolm Shaw - Jesus Redondo (part 11) and Johnny Johnstone (part 12))
name: 2000AD Showcase 36

description:
Reprints Slaine and Ukko's adventures from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Randy Elliott (Slaine)

  • Slaine - The King (parts 6-8) (prog 505-507) (Pat Mills - Glenn Fabry)
  • Luke Kirby - Summer Magic (part 2) (prog 572) (Alan McKenzie - John Ridgway)
  • Psi-Testers (progs 408-409) (Alan Hebden - Mike Dorey)
name: Slaine the King 23

description: Classic Strontium Dog reprints from the pages of British anthology comics 2000AD and Starlord.
name: Strontium Dog 23

description:
Classic Judge Dredd reprints from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Tom Lyle (Judge Dredd)

  • Gator (progs 384-386) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Kim Raymond)
  • Gribligs (progs 464-465) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Barry Kitson)
name: Judge Dredd 30

description:
Synopsis

S'ym stands on Darkchilde's body as he reaches for her Soulsword. She forces him out of the window behind them and sends him crashing down onto the street. She leaps upon S'ym and cuts his head off. However, he is able to pull himself back together thanks to the transmode virus. He continues to push his attack on her, but her spells send him backwards into the wall. The fight rages on.

Near Times Square, Mirage, Rusty, and Skids watch their team-mates fly off. However, the buildings and the road became animated and attack them. Far from powerless, the X-Terminators and New Mutants use their own mutant abilities to destroy anything that attacks them.

Meanwhile, below, Colossus marches through the streets. He interrogates minor demons to discover the location of his sister, but discovers that S'ym has overthrown Limbo. Caught unawares, the demons then pile onto Colossus.

On the rooftop of the Hellfire Club, the Inner Circle battles demons. Magneto is confronted by N'astirh, who offers a pact to rule the Earth between them. N'astirh then informs Magneto of the battle for power that over-threw Darkchilde's rule. The New Mutants fly by overheard and see Magneto discussing matters with N'astirh. They believe the two are most likely making a deal. They fly on, determined to have nothing to do with their headmaster any more.

S'ym's battle with the Darkchilde is interrupted when Colossus's armored body is thrown into the battle. S'ym threatens to kill Colossus for a second time and, even though she is not sure if he really is her brother, Darkchilde fights to protect him. The flashes from the fight are seen by the combined New Mutants and X-Terminators overhead. They fly closer and are surprised to see Darkchilde completely wrapped in her Eldritch Armor. They crash into a local, albeit possessed, pawn shop. Suddenly S'ym falls backwards through the window with Colossus pushing and crushing him. Colossus demands to know where his sister is and S'ym relishes in the moment as he reveals that Darkchilde is Illyana. Darkchilde cringes, embarrassed that her beloved brother sees her as such. In shame, she teleports away. The New Mutants and X-Terminators quickly leap into stepping disc behind her. They land back in Belasco's throne room. The New Mutants explain the basic rules of Limbo to Boom-Boom and Rictor while Darkchilde cringes in shame.

Back on Earth, Colossus continues to fight the demons and punches S'ym back through the pawn shop window and across the street. As their fight rages on, Wolfsbane implores Darkchilde in Limbo to return to Earth. Darkchilde refuses, claiming that such an action was what caused the power vacuum in the first place. The demons pick her up off the floor and carry her over to Belasco's throne where she sits as the ruler of Limbo.

On Earth, Colossus is slowly being overcome by the demons. And outside the church the remaining X-Terminators and New Mutants fight off he demon hordes. As a valkyrie, Mirage begins to see the dealthy image above Rusty, Skids, and herself. She collapses, unable to fend it off, and is caught by Artie and Leech.

In Limbo, Darkchilde's increased power allows her to create a newer and greater scrying glass. Through it she watches the fight between Colossus and S'ym, Manhattan's demon invasion, and Mirage's collapse all at the same time. Determined to do something to stop the Inferno, Darkchilde begins to glow pure, radiant, white light. The other New Mutants chase after Wolfsbane. Wolfsbane refuses to give up on Darkchilde's innocence and runs until she finds a chamber filled with floating stepping discs. Warlock and Cannonball grab her before she is able to throw herself into one. She breaks down in tears as she reveals her plan: Wolfsbane hopes to find the little child of Illyana they had seen previously. She hopes that future, past, and present are all connected in Limbo and wants to save both Darkchilde and Limbo by saving Illyana as a little girl. She leaps into the first stepping disc and the others follow her.

They fall into a barren field in Limbo. Sunspot grabs Wolfsbane by the arm, imploring her not to get them even more lost. Wolfsbane acknowledges how scared of Limbo she was and hates how terrified little Illyana must have been. She then finds another stepping disc and dives in. Again, the others follow her. They land in the middle of a group of transmode infected demons. Leaping through another stepping disc, Wolfsbane finds little Illyana and grabs her before falling through yet another light disc. As the New Mutants land, they are confronted by Darkchilde.

Glowing so brightly that they could barely see her, Darkchilde is horrified to see her younger self and swats Illyana away. Darkchilde's light grows even more intense as her power grows stronger. Her Eldritch Armor falls away from her and she stands towering as a fiery demon girl made of pure power. Darkchilde steps towards young Illyana and raises the Soulsword to execute her younger self in order to prevent it all from happening. Wolfsbane throws her arms around little Illyana and implores Darkchilde not to murder her own innocence. Wolfsbane reminds Darkchilde that she has a choice, which plays on her mind. Darkchilde recalls how N'astirh mocked concepts of good and evil among demons. She had learned to distrust what demons had told her, while she knew she could believe Wolfsbane.

Darkchilde decides to take herself out of the equation and remove the choice. The floor begins to glow and Darkchilde radiates even brighter as she teleports them all back to Times Square. The stepping disc grows over the city and sucks all the demons back to Limbo. In the heart of the falling demons, Darkchilde throws her Soulsword straight up into the air. It pierces the dark night sky, while Darkchilde herself is lost in the blinding light. Wolfsbane panics, as she had lost her hold of little Illyana.

Nearby by, Colossus's battle ends when S'ym is magically dragged back through the stepping disc. The remaining X-Terminators and New Mutants watch as the demons fly passed the church. Gosamyr appears from inside and offers to stay behind to watch the babies while Mirage, Rusty, and Skids run to Times Square.

In Times Square, the blinding light finally subsides and, in the dust, Wolfsbane finds the crushed Edlritch Armor. Colossus runs up and begins to despair for his little sister. Cannonball's tears stream down his cheeks. Mirage arrives and wraps her arms around Wolfsbane to console her. Colossus crouches down and picked up the crushed Eldritch Armor. A small voice from inside called his name. Little Illyana calls for help and Colossus rips the armor open. Underneath the metallic shell, Illyana lays curled up. Upon seeing her big brother, Illyana leaps out and hugs him around the neck. Wolfsbane looks up and is delighted to see Illyana alive and well. The little girl runs to Wolfsbane and they hug with tears of joy.

Cannonball thinks about how Darkchilde believed she was empty inside, but he knows that the little innocent girl was inside her all along. Rictor is confused, asking if it means that the teenaged Darkchilde had never existed. Cannonball knows that couldn't be right, because they could clearly remember her and that her sacrifice wasn't in vain. Wolfsbane clings to little Illyana and promises her a long life filled with joy.

They are all unaware that N'astirh sits on a ledge above them. He had survived Darkshilde's final spell that forced all the demons back to Limbo. He turns his attention to the top of the Empire State Building to the souls of baby Nathan Christopher Summers and his mother Madelyn Pryor, the Goblyn Queen.
name: The Gift

description:
1. "Where There is a Will...!"
  2. "Chapter I: The Decision"
  3. "Chapter II: The Decline"
  4. "Chapter III: The Summoning"
  5. "Chapter IV: The Restoration"

Notes:

  • Pages 1-4 penciled and inked by Gil Kane.
  • Pages 5-12 penciled by Steve Ditko and inked by Art Thibert.
  • The Superman story is reprinted in Superman: The Power Within #1 - TPB.
  • Final issue of Action Comics Weekly.
  • Series continues as Action Comics #643.
name: Where There is a Will...!

description:
Story #1 - God's Country Part 6 - Colossus - On orders of the mysterious man called Alexander, a team of renegade super powered government agents are intent on assassinating an American family, witness to a sanctioned murder. Only the Russian X- Man, Colossus, has stood as their protector, but now a new player enters the picture.

Story #2 - Panther's Quest Part 3 - Black Panther - The Black Panther has surreptitiously entered South Africa to learn if Patrick Slade, the owner of a curio store, really knows if his mother is alive or not. Before T'challa can learn the answer to that, they are attacked by a mercenary force that plays for keeps.

Story #3 -The Maiden Phoenix - Marvel Girl - The Phoenix Force summons Marvel Girl to aid it, but she discovers that it is not the true Phoenix Force that was summoning her, but the spirit of a long dead Morlock girl, who lived in the Morlock tunnels, named Lightning Bug, and now Lightning Bug wants to take over Marvel Girl's body so she can live again.

Story #4 - Desert Tears - Red Wolf - Red Wolf is badly injured and as he battles for his life, he takes a journey through the Spirit World to see the one who gave him his power, and learns that regardless of his past as a soldier, he has done well in being the Red Wolf and in the end he survives his injuries and continues as the hero Red Wolf.
name: God's Country (Part 6); Panther's Quest (Part 3); The Maiden Phoenix; Desert Tears;

description: Misery strikes at New York and Airboy and company go against him as the saga of what happen to Airboy and Valkyrie in the late stages of World War II continue in “The Diaries – Part 3 – Thirty Seconds Over Brooklyn.” Issue also has an Airboy Index and “The Black Prince,” a reprint of an original Black Angel story.
name: The Diares, Part 3 - Thirty Seconds Over Brooklyn

description:
The Elementals are still in a magical dimension helping Ambrose stop Demeter. Vortex locates Ratman and the two get in a tussle. Vortex knocks him out and starts to fly them back, when one of Demeter's guards catch them and shoots Vortex in the neck...both plummet to the ground and fail to return to the rest of their party.

Finally Ambrose and crew can wait no longer and with some rather unusual transportation (a huge tunneling slug), manage to storm Demeter's tower by surprise. The Elementals and guard fight Demeter's forces while Ambrose goes straight for Demeter. Demeter has the upper hand, but Ambrose pulls a trick spell on her and wins the day.

Meanwhile back home, Jeremy Skagg is once again contacted by an angelic being who insists that he use The Rapture to kill the Elementals. After Jeremy leaves...the true identity of the angel is revealed!
name: Good-Bye Yellow Brick Road

description:
Homicide returns with another dark, yet exciting episode, written by John Arcudi, art by Doug Mahnke. Also, Bob the Alien blunders through another aspect of life (is he really so different from any of us on a bad day?) from creator Rich Rice, and we present a second offering from Andrew Murphy entitled "Pressed for Time".

Chapters

Homicide - "Blood Storm"

Pressed for Time

Bob The Alien - "...Moves In"

Duckman - "The Mime Murders"
name: Homicide; Pressed for Time; Bob the Alien; Duckman

description:
Overview

A vanguard force of Space Aliens is establishing a beachhead for invasion up in the hills, and they're in cahoots with one of the Carrot's old archnemeses! Doom looms ominously. Meanwhile, the Carrot goes to the Flea Market and buys a shoe box full of old baseball cards for next to nothing...

The tavern of Selune's Smile is a place of many wondrous happenings, but none more mysterious then the night that the ghost of long dead jester walked through the door. Vajra, Onyx, and Kyri soon find themselves caught up in a murder mystery 100 years in the making.
name: The Spirit Of Myrrth, Part 1

description:
Lost in the void of space, Superman wrestles with his tormented conscience and hallucinations, with story and art by Jerry Ordway. Plus, part 2 of Lex Luthor's 4-part "Hostile Takeover" tale.

Notes:

  • "Apparitions' written, penciled and inked by Jerry Ordway, lettered by Albert De Guzman and colored by Glenn Whitmore.
  • "Insider Rumors!' "Hostile Takeover -- Part II" written by Roger Stern, penciled by Dan Jurgens, inked by Dennis Janke, lettered by Albert De Guzman, colored by Glenn Whitmore and "insider" by Jerry Ordway.
  • In "Apparitions" General Zod, Quex-Ul, Faora Hu-Ul and Brainiac appear as illusions.
  • Next chronological appearance is in Superman #31.
name: Apparitions / Insider Rumors!

person_credits.name: Jerry Ordway
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, inker, cover, other

description:
Invisible assailants are chasing Vixen! When Buddy faces down these assailants, the aliens who gave him his powers appear again.

The issue opens with a flashback to a silver age Animal Man story where Buddy fought an alien monster, and his hunting partner found another alien capsule similar to the one that gave Buddy super powers. The story then picks up today with Vixen running from an unseen enemy. Vixen arrives on the Baker family doorstep, but when the creatures that have been chasing her finally catch up, it's all out war in Buddy's living room!
name: Fox on the Run

description:
Batman teams up with a private investigator to find a 10-year-old boy abducted seven years earlier.

Batman infiltrates the F.B.I. in order to get a lead on a boy who disappeared seven years ago.
name: Dead Letter Office

description: The Blackhawks learn that things are "Better Dead Than Read" as they try to help a reporter expose a corrupt Senator who's trying to shut down the comic book industry.
name: Better Dead Than Read
